title: Introducing: MISSIO
content:
Given the tragic events unfolding in France over the past few days, there’s something rather chilling about sitting here listening to a cover of a song originally released in 1994 focusing on the IRA terrorist bombing a year earlier in Warrington which claimed two lives. The cover in question, by Austin’s MISSIO is a hauntingly beautiful take on The Cranberries’ Zombie, a poignant ode to Tim Parry and Jonathan Ball, yet more broadly feels like a plea to stop the senseless slaughter of innocents.

That coincidental connection aside, it’s a gorgeously layered composition; as is I Run To You, his debut single, a blossoming, emotionally wrought ballad, that more than marks MISSIO out as one to be keeping an eye on. Stay free. Stay peaceful.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
